item.title: Climate Biome Clustering
item.description: The climate of the planet varies depending on location. Regions with similar climatology are refereed to as climate biomes. There are many factors that determine how we perceive the climate. For example, precipitation, temperature, flora and fauna are key ingredients in our delineation of biomes. Therefore classifying biomes is akin to understanding the homogeneity of climate and resources on a local scale. Therefore, it is not only important that we can classify climate biomes, but also their evolution with the changing climate.

item.title: Operator Algebras Modeling Dynamics of Frames
item.description: For a Hilbert space $\mathscr{H}$, $y \in \mathscr{H}$ and $T \in \mathscr{B}(\mathscr{H})$, the equation \begin{equation} T x = y \end{equation} has a solution whenever $T$ is left invertible. For any left inverse $L$ of $T$, $x = L y$ is a solution. More generally, if $T$ has closed range, $T$ has a pseudo left inverse. Concretely, if $T \in \mathscr{B}(\mathscr{H})$ has closed range, restricting to $\ker(T)^\perp$ we obtain a new operator that is left invertible.
